TITLE: It may take $10 million to achieve 'financial freedom,' say 'Earn Your Leisure' hosts
SUMMARY: It's hard for most people to attain financial freedom, but trying will leave you better off, said Rashad Bilal and Troy Millings of podcast "Earn Your Leisure."

TITLE: Withdraw funds from inherited accounts now to avoid getting 'buried in taxes' later, IRA expert says
SUMMARY: It's possible to save on taxes by taking funds from inherited retirement accounts sooner, experts say. Here's what heirs need to know.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve may not hike interest rates next week, but consumers are unlikely to feel any relief
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is expected to announce no rate hike at the end of its two-day meeting next week. Here's what that means for your wallet.

TITLE: While most workers want a 4-day workweek, other job perks may be an easier way to get flexibility
SUMMARY: While most employees would welcome shorter weeks, other benefits that enable better work-life balance may be more readily available, experts say.

TITLE: Another public health crisis: 1 in 8 U.S. households struggle with food insecurity, government report finds
SUMMARY: Nearly 13% of U.S. households were food insecure in 2022, including more than 17% of families with children, a new USDA report finds.

TITLE: This Apple App Store billing policy can lead to overdraft fees, budget woes: 'It's a bizarre practice,' developer says
SUMMARY: Apple sometimes bundles multiple App Store purchases and subscriptions into a single transaction, which may not be charged to a user's account until days later.

TITLE: Here's how much you need to save to retire with $1 million if you're making $120,000 a year
SUMMARY: You can save $1 million for retirement while making $120,000 per year. Here's a breakdown of how much of your salary you'll need to invest.

TITLE: Shoppers have choices when it comes to payment plans. Here's how to pick between buy now, pay later and retail credit cards
SUMMARY: Retail credit cards and buy now, pay later programs both allow you to spread out payments for purchases. Here's how to know which works best for your finances.

TITLE: Retirement account withdrawal rules are 'so complicated' for inherited IRAs, expert says. What to know
SUMMARY: The retirement withdrawal rules for inherited individual retirement accounts are complicated. Here's what heirs need to know.

TITLE: Here are 4 ways health savings accounts can be used to pay insurance premiums
SUMMARY: In rare cases, consumers can use their health savings accounts, or HSAs, to pay insurance premiums while preserving the account's tax benefits.

TITLE: There’s a connection between workers’ mental health and retirement, emergency savings, research finds
SUMMARY: Financial planning for the future can be hard if you're struggling to get through the day. Research shows mental health may affect workers' financial preparedness.

TITLE: Homebuyers must earn more than $400,000 to afford a home in the 2 priciest metro areas — and New York isn’t one of them
SUMMARY: Would-be homebuyers need to earn more than $400,000 a year to afford an average house in the two priciest metro areas in the U.S.

TITLE: Credit card users paid $130 billion in fees, interest in 2022, federal watchdog says
SUMMARY: Americans paid $130 billion in credit card interest and fees in 2022, according to a new report. Here are three strategies to help limit those charges.

TITLE: New Europe travel requirement delayed again, to 2025
SUMMARY: Americans will need to get a travel authorization to visit most European nations starting in 2025. The requirement was supposed to take effect next year.

TITLE: Only 19% of Americans increased their emergency savings in 2023. That ‘puts households in a bind,’ expert says
SUMMARY: With inflation and higher interest rates taking a toll, fewer Americans are setting money aside in an emergency fund, according to a new report.

TITLE: Retirement withdrawal rules are 'crazy' this year, IRA expert says. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: Here's how to know if you need to take a required minimum distribution in 2023, according to an IRA expert.

TITLE: Biden administration rolls out new consumer protections for student loan borrowers
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has a plan to improve its oversight of higher education institutions and to bolster consumer protections for student loan borrowers.

TITLE: Picking health insurance can be tricky: 6 key terms to know as open enrollment starts
SUMMARY: Health plans have many moving parts such as premiums, co-insurance and deductibles that make it difficult to ascertain costs.

TITLE: Covid stimulus checks caused some Social Security, SSI beneficiaries to lose benefits. Lawmakers are pressing for answers
SUMMARY: Supplemental Security Income beneficiaries were supposed to get stimulus checks with no strings attached. Three U.S. senators say the opposite has happened.

TITLE: A risk of ‘cash stuffing:’ You may forgo ‘the easiest money you are ever going to make,’ says analyst
SUMMARY: After becoming popular on TikTok, more people are trying the envelope method, or "cash stuffing," to stay on budget and out of debt — but there is a better way.

TITLE: What to know as IRS kicks off withdrawal option for pandemic-era small business tax credit
SUMMARY: The IRS has announced a special withdrawal process for small businesses that wrongly claimed the employee retention tax credit. Here's what to know.

TITLE: These credit cards have had 'increasingly notable' high rates, analyst says. What to know before you shop
SUMMARY: The average APR for retail store credit cards is almost 30%. Here are a few things to consider when holiday shopping, according to experts.

TITLE: The 10-year Treasury tops key 5% level once again: Here’s what that means for you
SUMMARY: The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury is back above 5%, a key level that could impact mortgage rates, student debt, auto loans and more.

TITLE: Op-ed: Give from your estate now to reduce your tax exposure later
SUMMARY: In 26 months, some families who pay no inheritance tax will face sizeable federal taxes unless benefactors act now. Consider these strategies now to save later.

TITLE: Inaccurate bills, hours on the phone: Student loan borrowers reenter 'a very messy system'
SUMMARY: The Biden administration restarted student loan bills for 40 million Americans this month. So far, the transition is proving painful for many borrowers.

TITLE: Social Security may affect workers differently in 2024. Here are 3 key things to keep in mind
SUMMARY: In 2024, high earners may pay more Social Security taxes. Plus, working while receiving retirement benefits may have consequences. Here's what to know.

TITLE: As mortgage rates hit 8%, home 'affordability is incredibly difficult,' economist says
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates hit 8% for the first time in decades. Homebuyers must earn $114,627 to afford a median-priced house in the U.S., found real estate firm Redfin.

TITLE: This lesser-known 401(k) feature is a 'no-brainer' for big savers, advisor says
SUMMARY: Big savers can funnel more into 401(k) plans for 2023 with after-tax contributions. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: The 10-year Treasury yield just crossed 5% for the first time since 2007. Here’s what that means for you
SUMMARY: The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury crossed 5%, causing a ripple effect that could raise rates on mortgages, student debt, auto loans and more.

TITLE: Higher pay leads to surge in STEM graduates. Science, tech majors are 'the most lucrative,' says expert
SUMMARY: When it comes to the highest-paying bachelor's degrees, engineering and other STEM-related fields of study continue to dominate and students are taking note.
